titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Yale-China Association Records and Memorabilia
Yale-China Association Records and Memorabilia Papers
titlestmt.author: compiled by Manuscripts and Archives Staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Friday November 30, 2018 at 11:28

did.unittitle: Yale-China Association records and memorabilia

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The material consists of photographs and slides, correspondence, diaries, maps, banners, Chinese language documents, memoirs, scrolls, and ephemera documenting activities and experiences from the Yale-China Association.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Forms part of Yale Record Group 37 (YRG 37), Records of associations, institutes, centers, and organizations affiliated with Yale University.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Yale-China Association Records and Memorabilia (RU 235). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The materials were transferred from the Yale-China Association, 1980-2004.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The materials are arranged by accession.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The material consists of photographs and slides, correspondence, diaries, maps, banners, Chinese language documents, memoirs, scrolls, and ephemera documenting activities and experiences from the Yale-China Association.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright to the official records of the Yale-China Association is retained by the Association. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.
